DataElement.preferredName: Breast Sentinel Node Largest Metastasis Diameter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the value documenting the size of the largest metastatic involvement within a specimen taken from sentinel lymph nodes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Sentinel Node Largest Metastasis Diameter
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the length of a straight line passing through the center of the largest rounded mass of lymphatic tissue to which cancer has first spread from a primary tumor of the mammary organs.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: greatest in size of those under consideration.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: greatest in size of those under consideration.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the size of a lymph node.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement
